summary: This bill, the Streamlining Powerlines Essential to Electric Demand and Reliability Act of 2025 (SPEED and Reliability Act of 2025), amends the Federal Power Act to expedite the siting of electric transmission facilities deemed in the national interest. It modifies definitions, clarifies permitting processes for construction and modification, emphasizes state consultation and landowner input, and addresses cost allocation and coordination of federal authorizations. The bill aims to improve reliability, reduce congestion, and enhance energy independence by streamlining permitting and investment in electric transmission infrastructure.
